website_summaries.verdict: Canon's SX120 IS pocket megazoom falls behind the competition in every aspect except photo quality.
cons: Fewer features, slower performance, and bulkier design than competitive models

customer_reviews.title: old tech
customer_reviews.text: OMG, I bought this so looooong aga! Now it sits in a drawer. It was my go to camera for a long time. It still works and for a kid could be a great deal as a first camera. I liked the small size, could fit in pants pocket, but not shirt. Newer cameras on market are highly improved, smaller and more megapixels.
customer_reviews.author: MAURICE in California

customer_reviews.title: Great starter camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's birthday. She wanted to get into photography. I didn't want to go broke just to find out it wasn't her passion. This is the perfect starter camera! You can adjust the settings to focus, zoom, and lighting. You can also record! Shipping was super fast, said I was going to receive it the 12th-17th and got it on the 9th! Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Starla

customer_reviews.title: Canon SX120IS
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice camera. Battery life is excellent, especially with lithium batteries. I really like the true colors in the pictures and it's ability to take good quality photos in fairly dim light without the use of a flash. I've been using it for close to a year and have found it to be durable and reliable. It is very versatile having both manual and automatic modes, as wells having video capability. It does have one annoying shortcoming...there is no viewfinder. Sometimes it is difficult to see the display well enough in very bright light, ie at the beach, to properly compose a picture. It would be the perfect camera if it had a viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: Grizz

customer_reviews.title: I had a camera like this for years and then it started to not ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a camera like this for years and then it started to not keep battery life. The batteries lasted for a couple of pictures. I figured the camera was just getting old. So I found where I could buy one just like it brand new. This camera does the same thing. Not sure why as this is supposed to be a brand new camera...and it was as it just came out of a packaged box. Anyway, I kept the camera and just bought a different one. Otherwise if the batteries would last I liked the way the camera takes pictures.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl taivalmaa

customer_reviews.title: The best seller ever.
customer_reviews.text: The description of this item was used good, but the item was in excellent condition, I was very happy. It can from Israel, not only a good price, but also fast delivery. Plus, unknown to me, the package came with a usb port battery charger, and a card reader, I was pleasantly surprised. Needless to say, I was over the top happy with everything about the seller, thanks again from Bowie, Arizona.
customer_reviews.author: sidekick44

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera at the time I bought it, but not worth the price now
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera a couple of years ago and at the time it was a pretty nice camera for the price range. It works good, I find the zoom is not that great if your zooming much of a distance at all. It takes pretty nice pictures, my biggest frustration with it is the delway when you push down till when it takes the picture, I find it takes too long to focus, and a lot of times you miss the shot if your trying to take a picture of your child smiling or getting something funny. Pretty good camera, but not worth the money now
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX120IS 10MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because of the optical 10x zoom and image stabilization. My previous experience with Canon PowerShot cameras has been very good. The picture environment selections (Auto, night, portrait, and so on) are excellent, especially the indoor lighting modes. The video mode is especially good, and much improved over my previous PowerShot. I've noticed that I do a little less photo fixing in Adobe Photoshop Elements as the images are clearer and the color seems to be better. I was a little concerned about the lack of an optical viewfinder, but the LCD screen has so far been very good, even in bright daylight.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasT

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely fabulous camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new camera to replace my Sony Cybershot. I needed a camera that was better than the Sony, but still compact enough to fit in my purse. After thorough research and testing cameras at Best Buy, I settled on this camera and feel I made the best choice with this Canon. This camera takes excellent photos; the zoom is phenomenal. I was at the San Francisco Giants Parade and wasn't close at all, but I was still able to get photos of players riding on trolley cars. Overall, I would recommened this camera to those who are not ready to take the leap into the pricer cameras, but need a good camera to take everyday photos.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great photo's!
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great except the date stamp. Every time you turn off the camera it resets the date stamp to 1980.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalee Clayton

customer_reviews.title: It's a snap!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm no Ansel Adams, in fact I used to use those little throw away cameras. Somehow my techie daughter talked me into buying this camera and I still can't quite believe it. It really is easy to operate and the pictures are fantastic! I know I am not savvy enough to use all the apps yet, but I am coming along. I really love the 10x zoom and the simple settings; portrait, landscape, etc. I read that the battery life is not the best, so I have been carrying around extras for nearly two months but I haven't needed them yet. If you need a camera and are a bit of a technophobe, this is the camera for you.
customer_reviews.author: M. Colee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: A very nice camera, small enough to put in your pocket. Has many modes to make it easy to get good pictures in all settings. Only problem I had was remembering to wait for the green box to appear after pushing down on shutter button half way, before pushing all the way to take the picture. I use Alkaline batteries, and I take a lot of pictures,so it seems like I go through a set of batteries at least one per day. I am very pleased with the camera. 10x optical zoom is great. Used it on 7 day Europe river cruise and took between 800 and 900 pictures and they were great. Strongly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning how to operate my camera. I would have preferred a written manual to the CD simply because with my lifestyle I am not always near a computer to access the manual. I like to read at night and I can study the written manual and re-read functions that I intend to use. I almost returned the camera because I could not find any written reference to delayed shots. This feature is very important to my lifestyle and after several days of frustration I popped in the CD and there it was. The CD may work for some lifestyle but is a huge hassel for me. I want a written manual with all the details. V.Thomas KC,MO
customer_reviews.author: V. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Camera!
customer_reviews.text: The 10MP/10x Zoom is what attracted me to this camera, since I do alot of shots from far away at conventions. I tried it out immediately after it arrived at an event and it worked SO WELL! The far away shots are like I'm right there next to the guests. The color and sharpness cannot be beat. Also, the close-up shots are amazing, too. I'm set to go out and take nature shots again today because the initial ones just blew my mind with how beautiful they turned out. I would highly rec this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lynn Workman

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, amazing pictures
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect camera for people who want to take professional looking pictures without paying for an expensive, top-of-the line camera. The zooming capabilities far surpass any other cameras I have ever used in this price range. And this camera allows me to easily take crisp and clear close-up pictures. The batteries don't last as long as my last camera, but that's not a problem if you use rechargeables. And the flash sometimes takes a few seconds to "recharge" so you have to wait in between taking multiple pictures with flash. However, this camera takes great, in-focus pictures without needing flash in most settings. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bleeker

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I just wrote a fairly long review on everything that I found that I love about my new camera (macro-focus, flash setup, picture quality, etc), and then my computer froze the page and erased my review. So, Im not going to write it all again but I will just say this, I am very pleased with this camera. I have been used to SLR camera and wanted a smaller, more portable one for use on my deployment to Afghanistan. This was an awesome choice. Canon rarely disappoints me. Thanks again.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: This has been an outstanding camera
customer_reviews.text: I have used this camera for several years now. Purchased to allow me to take more dense close-ups, which could be expanded without becoming pixelated, this camera has exceeded my wishes. Easy to operate, with several options to still allow for photographic choice, this camera comes with an easy camera to computer transfer protocol and continues to do credit to the Canon name.
customer_reviews.author: Cymbeline

customer_reviews.title: Great if you just want great Pics
customer_reviews.text: I'm not and expert on cameras so I cant go in dept of its functions, pros and cons. What I can say is that if you just love great quality pictures then this is the best for its price. I ordered this camera and 2 days later (yes I said 2 days standard shipping) it was delivered, the quality shots are great and the price is unbeatable. I am too happy with this product and seller. A good camera has to have great service and that's what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job
customer_reviews.text: I asked a friend, who takes lots of pictures at concerts, to recommend a good camera for low-light conditions. She recommended this one. I should have done more research. It takes decent pictures, but, at distance and in low light, the pictures do not come out good. I'm sure some of the "issues" can be attributed to me, however, I believe this is a digital camera for everyday situations.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D

customer_reviews.title: I Like the Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is what I was looking for in a camera. Easy to use, and takes good pictures, especially close ups. Only complaints I have(which are minor),it goes thru batteries fairly quick and sometimes it's hard to see screen when in the direct sun. I bought four recharable batteries for less than ten dollars so that should take care of battery complaint. Sometimes I may have to shade camera if using in the sun. No big deal. Over all, I've been very happy with purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Thunder

customer_reviews.title: Every face sharp and clear
customer_reviews.text: For very good photo quality and point-and-shoot convenience, this camera is a winner. My favorite feature is the Face Detection technology, which puts a square around each face showing on the screen. Before you click the shutter, you know whether everyone is in focus! Even a 10-person family photo came out sharp and clear (kiddies and all), and that's important when printing 8 x 10 photos. Too bad Canon doesn't package more than a 32MB SD memory card with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Marian W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Great Service Great Timing
customer_reviews.text: This camera definitely exceded my expectations! Everything was included and in great shape. I ordered it for my boyfriends Christmas present, and it arrived at my door well before. And I was hoping it would be a quality camera for him, and he absolutely loves it. Thank you very much, and I won't hesitate to be a repeat customer!
customer_reviews.author: MamaMaisyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. I get stunning images from this camera comparable to much more higher end cameras. It was a very good deal as well, shipped fast and replaces another of the same with a few to many miles on it.
customer_reviews.author: John Kuehnert

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly enjoying this camera. I'm just back from a trip out west and am very pleased with the quality of photos I came home with. I haven't yet mastered all the special settings, but when I did use them, they performed beautifully. I had wanted a better camera than the several year old digital that I had, but didn't want to get into the world of SLR's and this camera is a terrific compromise between size and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The camera is great and was purchased as a replacement for an identical ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great and was purchased as a replacement for an identical model that was stolen. I was disappointed that it was stripped of the operating card. Fortunately, I had all the information relative to its operation from my original. If this item was purchased by someone who did not have any instruction material, I think the item would have been worthless,
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd J. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It's easy to use & takes great pictures. A friend told me she loves it so much that she bought several for gifts. I have to agree with her. Like all cameras that take batteries, you must spend a little more and buy the lithium ones. I don't care for cameras with charging docks, your batteries always seem to die when you can't plug the camera in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use - Fully Automatic Digital
customer_reviews.text: Best Digital Camera I ever bought for under $200 which is the most I am willing to pay for a camera. Fully Automatic, takes excellent pictures 99% of the time, and it took me all of 5 minutes to learn how to use it. The only negative really is the longevity of the batteries, which is expected - make sure you switch-off between uses or set the auto-off.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Hart

customer_reviews.title: Not so good pictures
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to replace a smaller kodak digital camera hopping the pictures will be the same or better quality and based on reviews by other customers, but what a disappointment, the pictures come out too blurry and takes way to long to take next pictures, I'm going to sale it and get a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Fumanchu

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX120IS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera back in 2010 and it works very well. I took it to Hawaii and took TONS of pictures. I like digital cameras with AA batteries so I can just pop in new batteries inside of having to recharge a battery. Lithium batteries work much longer than alkaline.
customer_reviews.author: BIGFOOTDWR

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Everything works as expected. I am not sure about the problem reviews I read from others. I am Very happy with the Camera. The only problem I had was not formatting the furnished memory card before using it. I am working thru that problem now, but that has nothing to do with the performance or features of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: MaDaHada

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality varies widely
customer_reviews.text: Outside it takes brilliant pictures, inside, not that great. Most of the time they come out very pixelated and the flash has a long delay and is blinding for those in the picture. It also drains the batteries (no matter brand or price and forgot it if they are not rechargeable) so fast you can't get through an entire event with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cohan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I am very, very pleased with this camera. Nice, clear shots, with minimal effort on my part. Only thing I wish is that there wasn't a delay. When taking shots of moving targets--like birds or grandkids--I don't always get the shot I wanted. All in all, I'm extremely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Very Good, but needs a viewfinder.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a good value. It is light and compact, takes great pictures and videos, and is easy to operate. If it had a viewfinder, it would be great. But, having to use the 3" LCD display as a viewfinder is very awkward when using it in sunlight. In sunlight it can be almost impossible to see anything on the LCD display. I like the camera, but this is a major drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Ilai

customer_reviews.title: Good camera that could be better!
customer_reviews.text: The date has to be reset each time the camera is turned off. This is my biggest complaint!
customer_reviews.author: Dave D.

customer_reviews.title: Miss the viewfinder; like the screen size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Powershot A720 IS. This is a little heavier but the big screen is nice. However, not having a viewfinder is a problem at times in terrifically bright sunshine. As always, I resent having to go online for manuals--the A720 complete manual was included and thus could be easily carried with me if I needed a reference. No longer is this done.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H. Christian

customer_reviews.title: New to digital
customer_reviews.text: This camera has surpassed my expectations! Wonderfully easy to use and carry. The versitility is amazing and I can't express my pleasure in this purchase. I did not even realize, when I bought this item that I could produce a video as well! Far surpasses anything I'd anticipated... WOW!
customer_reviews.author: Dagmar

customer_reviews.title: Camera was a gift
customer_reviews.text: As I said, the camera was a gift. My friend likes it and has enjoyed taking photos. Too bad it doesn't come with some kind of location device, he keeps loosing it in his house. Only to find it days later. Maybe the yard gnomes are borrowing it and taking some lovely garden pictures. Too bad they never leave anything on the card.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Canon Saved a Loyal Customer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Canon A1100IS for my wife. I was not happy with the grainy blurry pictures it took. What a pos. I have other canon products and have been pleased with them so I figured I would give Canon another try. This SX120IS dose the job. The pictures are crisp and clear, the 10x zoom is good, I would recomend this camera. I purchased through Amazon and as usual it was an easy and painless process.
customer_reviews.author: RJW

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Probably would be okay for the price but mine arrived defective.
customer_reviews.author: Angela J. Zito

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and can't be told from new.
customer_reviews.text: Can't find anything wrong with camera and it works well. No Manual, but for $11 I got a full sized one on line. Most used items have some dust or residue in the cracks and crevices or oil reside from fingerprints. This camera could be sold as new.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Whiting

customer_reviews.title: The Kobayashi Review
customer_reviews.text: This one was to replace my broken one which was SX110. I really like my SX120. There are not many differences, but the ones that are there are noticeable. I really enjoy using this camera. I believe its a little better than my SX110 which is now broken.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Owen

customer_reviews.title: Love this canon.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my father. He LOVES it. He won't stop taking pictures with it! He brings it everywhere he goes. Canon is always a great brand for consumers. This is a great camera for the average consumer.
customer_reviews.author: BountyrollosTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Great camera - way too sensitive to bumps
customer_reviews.text: Great camera - way too sensitive to bumps. Camera fell 6” from my hand to table and never worked again.
customer_reviews.author: Off-leash

customer_reviews.title: Great Still Pictures
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera about 5 months and just got back from vacation using it every day. Most pictures turned out great. The color was very good as was the contrast. However the slightest movement caused the picture to blur. I tried to change the picture mode but that didn't seem to help. Taking pictures of children is almost impossible unless they are standing still. This is my second Cannon and the previous pocket size one without Image Stabilization was much better than this one and was less expensive. If anyone has any suggestions please let me know because right now I would have to say the camera is not working as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: RHJ III

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed it and takes very good photos
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed it and takes very good photos. Be careful not to get the back glass broken. I put some cover over it like a hard plastic that can be bought at any photo store.
customer_reviews.author: Star Trek man

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, just a bit bulky
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is excellent, but it's just a tad big for a pocket camera. I bought it to replace a nice little Panasonic item that was stolen, and was looking for something to replace it that also took AA batteries. So far I'm quite satisfied, but still learning the ins and outs of the tech details. Overall, I'd rate it at about 4 1/2 stars- the screen can be hard to see in sunlight, and it's slightly bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Reale

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but still learning its potential
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera just before Christmas 2009 and although I'm pleased with function so far there are still features I've not mastered. The one "druther" I'd list at this time is a covered LCD screen..I'm trying to be very careful to prevent scratching.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: While I can't say much about the bundled software or the special effects (don't need or use either of them), the rest of the camera is brilliant - I was able to figure out how to use it in a couple of minutes and it's performed flawlessly since then, giving me great results. Good batteries are a must - the generic batteries it came with didn't last long. I got some Eneloop rechargeables, and they last much longer. Overall, it's a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ace Winner

customer_reviews.title: A great camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my 2 year old PS SX 120IS that did not survive a kyacking outting recently. I have found the camera to meet my needs completely. By buying through Amazon I saved over $75 on a new one, although I doubt that this one was used more than twice (everything appeared new). Delivery was as promised. I am a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: mitch

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera for a class. No issues. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Mmitchell

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX120IS
customer_reviews.text: After much shopping on line and in store, I found the best buy at Amazon and I feel like I have found "the camera" that a 73 yr old Grandma can operate! I may never learn to use all the settings, but already know enough to take good pics of all my Grandkids/Family/Friends. When you get older, all you have are pics!! My older Canon had to be replaced after it fell in the lake (so did I, partially) Buy it, you'll like it. JJ
customer_reviews.author: Janet R. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: It is the best reasonably-priced camera camera for closeups I have found
customer_reviews.text: This camera will take closeups less than 1.5". It is the best reasonably-priced camera camera for closeups I have found
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: Good quality with excellent price I recommend it to everyone is looking for this product Thanks this will not be my first time :
customer_reviews.text: Good quality with excellent price I recommend it to everyone is looking for this product Thanks this will not be my first time :)
customer_reviews.author: Ramy Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: great product! I use several of these in the field
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! I would recommend it, much better than the one that followed it. The image is crisp and the zoom is awesome! The buttons on the back are too easy to bump and change settings.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Capps

customer_reviews.title: Not for inside
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay camera but it is not a low-light, indoor camera, which even Canon admits. This may be a fine camera for outside but inside the pictures were grainy, dim & not nearly as clear as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. MillerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Battery Eater - Fuzzy Pictures
customer_reviews.text: Battery life was dissappointing. Was only able to get 50 pictures on akaline batteries. Swithed to rechargable batteries and had the same results. Using fully charged batteries the camera would turn off and give the replace batteries message. The picture quality was worse than my old 4mp camera. I expected more sharpness and detail. When shooting outdoors while the sun is shining the screen is impossilble to see for framing your shot. This camera was a step down rather than a step up which is why I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: R&M

customer_reviews.title: So Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: With this camera, I have taken more pictures than ever before. Unfortunately I am not well versed in all the features and haven't taken the time to learn everything. But in spite of that, I take pictures that just turn out spectacular. I just like to keep it simple, and am very pleased with the results. I take lots of closeups of cactus blossoms.
customer_reviews.author: Art by Nina

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is using this to chronicle the years events for her High School band. She is the historian for the class and loves the ease and quality the camera provides.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: My wife and daughter both have versions of this camera and when I saw this one for that cheap, I jumped on it. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Haven Wildcat

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera; great photos
customer_reviews.text: Have no complaints about this product. See so many people with the same camera. Never had a problem with it. Love it. Takes awesome photos
customer_reviews.author: CaringConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot SX120
customer_reviews.text: Pros ... I love the 10x zoom, snappy performance of all features, 10MP gives fine detail and color is excellent. Camera size and weight are ideal. Fits in my small hand nicely. Cons ... I miss the optical viewer and the neck strap. Comes only w/ wrist strap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Took great pictures. You have to use batteries with extra long life, and not the normal everyday battery. Other than that, it is a great camera. Took over 2000 shots in a week, and every shot came out great.
customer_reviews.author: Malphoto

customer_reviews.title: Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is our first digital camera. It came quickly and in perfect condition. I am still learning how to use it, but my photojournalist daughter pronounced it "a really terrific little camera."
customer_reviews.author: Merle N. Savedow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera in Great Condition.....better than Iexpected! Super Fast Shipping!
customer_reviews.author: lyboon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pictures... but fatal lens error failure after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my daughter to use on a study abroad program and thereafter. The picture quality was great, she felt it was straightforward to use, although battery life didn't seem fantastic. But the deal killer is that 10 months later, with no warning or obvious reason, it is bricked with the apparently-famous "lens error -restart camera" problem. Tried various simple fixes as noted on forums to no avail. So now it's just an expensive doorstop. I have had better luck with my Fuji digital camera, which is simple and reliable for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Jackstraw

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas after learning hers was kaput. The construction quality, picture quality and ease of operation impressed the both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Bourrie

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX120IS
customer_reviews.text: It works and looks like new! The price was great! The product is in perfect shape! I would buy another one if I needed only at Amazon ( The Best )!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Claudianett / Fit N God

customer_reviews.title: Previous Generation Was Better
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous version of this camera, and am not impressed with the "update." Picture quality is about equal, but the casing of the camera feels much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: E. Heatherington

customer_reviews.title: Camera Review
customer_reviews.text: This is a good camera except that it consumes way too much power. It uses 2 AA batteries which has to be constantly changed after a day of shooting. In our recent one week vacation, we exhausted about 10 or so AA batteries and that is ridiculous. My other Cannon PowerShot camera which uses rechargeable battery pack is much more cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX120IS 10MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: DEMASIADO BUENA LA CALIDAD DE LAS FOTOGRAFÍAS Y LUEGO QUE LEES EL MANUAL ES DEMASIADO FACIL DE USAR, DE VERDAD QUE FUE LA OPCIÓN MÁS ACERTADA EN CUANTO A CALIDAD Y COSTO. LA RECOMIENDO AL 100%
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Camacho

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: i love my canon powershot!!! it's easy to use and the zoom is amazing!! the only complaint i have is that it goes through batteries rather quickly. you have to make sure you always have spares with you.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Muoio

customer_reviews.title: Love this Camera!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that I would love to add to this Camera is a rechargable battery, but then that would add more to the price. I think this camera is great!
customer_reviews.author: kjohn6969

customer_reviews.title: Best affodable camera out there!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! great pictues! easy to use, light weight, big screen, the zoom is incredible! its also under 200 bucks! Best affodable camera!
customer_reviews.author: photolover

customer_reviews.title: Great performer!
customer_reviews.text: Here is an excellent little camera with a decent zoom. It certainly has overcome the battery problems associated with its predecessor. Its easy to use and virtually noise-free. I still would have preferred an optical viewfinder along with the screen, but it doesn't affect the quality.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera, I'm amateur photographer and bought it 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Camera, I'm amateur photographer and bought it 6 years ago. At that time it still works BEST, doing awfull pictures. HIGH QUALLITY CAM, it's not only for fun, you can really work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Heinrich Sauter

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect in low lighting and if you set the adjustments per the user guide it's perfect in any lighting condition.
customer_reviews.author: DiabeticHolli

customer_reviews.title: Canon SX120IS
customer_reviews.text: The Canon SX120IS is everything I expected. Easy to use in Auto or you can manage different aspects of your picture taking experience.
customer_reviews.author: ejmj

customer_reviews.title: What a great camera
customer_reviews.text: This a just a great little camera, nothing fancy but simple and easy to handle. The 3rd Canon SX120IS we had, as we dropped the other 2. Takes very clear close up pictures and landscapes.
customer_reviews.author: Trotte

customer_reviews.title: a great seller was glad to have business with you product ...
customer_reviews.text: a great seller was glad to have business with you product was exactly as it is written, thank you very much for everything)) +++++
customer_reviews.author: Roma

customer_reviews.title: great buy here
customer_reviews.text: Worked great going to order new one, can non is better over many I have used and will continental to :)
customer_reviews.author: Mariah P

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX120IS 10MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera!! Easy to use and takes beautiful pictures. Since my last camera required rolls of film which had to be developed, I love the ability to view the pictures right after I take them. Yes, I am slowly crawling out of the last century!!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Mylly

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: A super point and shoot camera. On a recent tour of RI Lighthouses I took many photos and I was completely satisfied with the results. Battery life is good if you get the latest in rechargeable batteries. To get the most out of this camera you need to read the instruction booklet that unfortunately did not come with the camera. You have to get it on line and if you want a copy you have to print it. All 141 pages. It took forever to print. This is the only negative I have about my purchase. Aside from Canon trying to save printing costs, I am quite happy with the camera.I do miss the viewfinder though.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The PowerShot SX120 IS is a great little camera, I chose it for a number of reasons, one being its size. It's small enough to fit in my purse but large enough that I have something to hold on to. The viewing screen is large and very clean and crisp. I have owned several Canons and always been pleased with them. I am a skilled photographer, certainly not a professional one, and find this Canon user friendly. I am very pleased with the photos I have taken and love the telephoto lens. The camera was affordable. Two of my friends followed buying the Power Shot after checking mine out.
customer_reviews.author: DMK

customer_reviews.title: My First Time
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures. I also experienced after 150-180 pictures before batteries were low. That's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent condition
customer_reviews.text: I bought it used, in a like new condition, and received it promptly. No scratches, that I could see, and in solid condition. My old sx120 died on me while I was on vacation and it's been the one powershot that I've really come to love so I searched for an exact replacement. So far, it's working wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Galleta

customer_reviews.title: Too slow!!
customer_reviews.text: While this camera takes very nice pictures you have to have a near motionless subject. The camera is slow to focus and take the shot. The auto review seldom shows the picture you just took but some blurry after image.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in AK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my older (broken one) at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have never had luck with Canons, they never last long and this one was no exception.
customer_reviews.author: ELee

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It has been a treasure with clear photos.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Dupuis

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchas
customer_reviews.text: Camera fits the everyday photographer. Easy to use and took vivid pictures of my trip to Japan. Would recommend to anyone who wants to point and shoot
customer_reviews.author: Tara Fazenbaker

customer_reviews.title: fantastic pics,
customer_reviews.text: Compact,easy to use, lots of features for adjustment, like the AA battery power supply, like the quality of pictures would recommend this camera for the point and shoot crowd and for those a little more advanced.
customer_reviews.author: dougintx

customer_reviews.title: good camera
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems to work great but the Red eye. The pictures are a little more blurry with movement than my old A550.
customer_reviews.author: James Rairigh

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX120IS
customer_reviews.text: Camera is very nice besides how quickly it uses batteries. I recommend planning to buy rechargable AA batteries if buying this camera. Also, the flash is not that great but overall it seems to be a pretty nice camera. A Great buy for your money!
customer_reviews.author: Kirk D. Buehler

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have it again
customer_reviews.text: I had this camera since 3 years ago and had recorded so many good memories with it, unfortunately I lost it in the water way. I am very happy I could find a used one in very good condition with reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: shagha

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best camera I've ever owned. It has the best clarity and zoom of any camera I've had and I've taken it everywhere. I lost the first Canon PowerShot I had on a trip in Ireland and was heartbroken so I bought another as soon as I got back home.
customer_reviews.author: Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The batteries drains quickly but I get great pictures and use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Optical 10 Zoom
customer_reviews.text: Like the way the camera feels in my hands, while taking pictures. Great zoom capabilities. Find it a little tricky to open the battery/SD card holder. It seems to get stuck often. Overall, very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Byerly

customer_reviews.title: The Best Camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I gave this camera to my wife for her B-Day. And this camera, has become my best friend, because now my wife gives me more time for myself, since she spents most of her time with this camera. The camera is great, I'm not a photographer, but all you need is to know who appriciated good pictures, and this camera sure know how to do that. And for the price, is a very nice product. I'll Recommended to anyone
customer_reviews.author: FRANK

customer_reviews.title: exelent for the price
customer_reviews.text: For 200 bucks a wonderful camera for all around pictures. exelent picture quality for something in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: M. M

customer_reviews.title: very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this camera for a few years now.. I am still just as happy with it as the day I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Weezlemum

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes fantastic pictures. Its like having an SLR camera with out shelling out for one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SX120IS 10MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Images Stabilized Zoom and 3-inch LCD
product_meta.description:
A big, easy zoom. Everything about the PowerShot SX120 IS is easy. The Smart AUTO feature makes every shot picture perfect. An impressive 10x Optical Zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer keeps you sharp and steady. There’s even an Easy Mode that makes shooting super simple.Just set the Canon PowerShot SX120 IS to Smart AUTO and you're ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture taking every time. It's a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject, knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 A big, easy zoom. Everything about the PowerShot SX120 IS is easy. The Smart AUTO feature makes every shot picture-perfect. An impressive 10x Optical Zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer keeps you sharp and steady. There’s even an Easy Mode that makes shooting super simple. 

PowerShot SX120 Highlights 

Smart AUTO detects and analyzes faces, brightness, colors, distance, and movement
Just set the Canon PowerShot SX120 IS to Smart AUTO and you're ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture taking every time. It's a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject, knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 18 specially defined settings. So whether you're photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you're getting dramatic, memorable images. 

Easy Mode makes capturing images as easy as 1-2-3
Even if you've never picked up a camera before, with Canon's new Easy Mode you can take inspiring, dramatic pictures that will impress everyone. Once you choose Easy Mode, the PowerShot SX120 IS handles all the details automatically. It automatically sets every camera control, including the flash, to reduce blur and improve image quality. So you get pictures that are bright, clear and natural just by pushing a button. Best of all, you can relax and concentrate on what really counts--your subject. 

With 20 Shooting Modes including 8 Special Scene Modes, you're ready for whatever shot comes your way. 



10x optical zoom in action High-powered 10x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer
The PowerShot SX120 IS has a 10x Optical Zoom lens that makes it easy to get the inspiring, emotive close-ups that will make your images lasting keepsakes. This magnificent lens gives you the power to shoot distant subjects with razor-sharp precision and stunning lifelike color. So you can brilliantly capture a bird high atop a tree, a child’s winning goal from across the stadium or a school play from the last row. Plus, thanks to Canon’s highly sophisticated Optical Image Stabilizer Technology, even at maximum zoom, every image is rock steady. 

The PowerShot SX120 IS is equipped with Canon’s acclaimed Optical Image Stabilizer Technology that automatically detects and corrects camera shake--one of the leading causes of fuzzy or blurred shots. Even when zoomed in, you can get the steady, crisp, brilliant images you’ll be proud to shoot and share. And Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer Technology is convenient to use. It functions perfectly with or without a flash. 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor 
With DIGIC 4, your images boast superior quality, the camera operates at top efficiency and battery life is enhanced. What’s more, the DIGIC 4 Image Processor enables Canon’s Face Detection, Motion Detection Technologies and Red-eye Correction to give you better, more true-to-life people shots. Simply press the shutter button halfway down, and the camera automatically pinpoints the faces in the scene and chooses the ideal focus point. The camera controls exposure settings and flash to keep every face looking bright and natural. The camera also selects and sets the optimal exposure and ISO settings automatically to keep everything looking sharp and clear. Red-eye Correction can be handled in-camera, in two ways. The Red-eye Correction during shooting uses the Face Detection Technology to recognize and remove red-eye from images as they're taken, before the file is written to the memory card. It's also possible to correct red-eye during image playback, using simple settings in the PowerShot SX120 IS menu. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the fast DIGIC 4 Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

DIGIC 4 features Face Detection Technology, giving you the best possible results in any shooting situation. Face Detection AF/AE sets the focus point and exposure for the faces of your subjects. Face Detection FE adjusts the flash to correctly illuminate your subject to provide the best balance between your subject and the overall scene, eliminating the common problems of over and underexposed faces. 

Face Detection WB means the camera concentrates upon faces when calculating white balance for the best possible skin tones. Face Select and Track lets you highlight one face among several in a scene, and the camera concentrates on that person, even as they move around the scene. Face Detection Technology is a powerful contributing factor in Canon's Motion Detection Technology. 

Simply press the Face Selector Button, then the selected face is double-framed and tracked when the face moves in the frame. 

Motion Detection Technology works in the background to instantly evaluate how fast your subject is moving. It automatically selects and sets the optimal exposure and ISO settings to keep everything looking sharp and clear. This feature provides higher ISOs when you need it for action-stopping shutter speeds. But when no movement is detected, it sets lower ISOs for excellent color and detail. 

Life doesn’t give you second chances to capture special times. That’s why the PowerShot SX120 IS features an ISO 1600 setting that reduces the effects of camera shake and sharpens subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures. 
1) The Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken. 
2) The PowerShot SX120 IS can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback. 

Large 3.0-inch PureColor System LCD
You’ll want to have your PowerShot SX120 IS with you wherever you go, and a slim new design makes it easy. Subtly rounded for an easy grip, the camera exudes modern elegance and simplicity. The back panel’s neat, intuitive interface includes a luxuriously big 3.0-inch PureColor System LCD screen. And the PureColor System LCD screen’s quality is as impressive as its size: you’ll get an exceptionally clear, bright view of all your shots, and enjoy a conveniently wide viewing angle for showing off your pictures to friends and family. 

AA battery powered camera enables you to easily power up
Conveniently, you don’t need to worry about running out of batteries or having to recharging them. Since AA-size batteries can be purchased at any store, simply get new ones locally--wherever you go, no special power adapters or chargers are needed. 

What's in the Box  * PowerShot SX120 IS Body 
 * AA-size Alkaline Battery (x2) 
 * SD Memory Card SDC-32MB 
 * Wrist Strap WS-800 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM 
 * USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU 
 * AV Cable AVC-DC400

DIGIC 4 Image Processorand 10 megapixel resolution for poster size, photo quality prints

Easy Mode takes all the guesswork out of the equation by determining the right shooting mode
